title: Concussion rate in the U.S. 2010 to 2015 , by age
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Rate per 1,000 members, with a total of 15 data points. The chart has 5 significant trends.
The longest trend is extremely negative which exists from <1_year to 15-17_years.
Conversely, the next significant trend is slightly positive which exists from 15-17_years to 30-34_years.
In a similar manner, the next significant trend is moderately positive which exists from 30-34_years to 40-44_years.
Similarly, the next significant trend is moderately positive which exists from 40-44_years to 50-54_years.
In a similar manner, the next significant trend is moderately neutral which exists from 50-54_years to 60-64_years.
gold: The highest rate of concussions among U.S. Blue Cross Blue Shield ( BCBS ) members from 2010 to 2015 was among those aged 15 - 17 years . Among that age group the rate of concussion was 18.8 per 1,000 members . Unsurprisingly , the age group with the lowest rate of concussion was those aged less than 1 year .
